item.title: Over growth of low branches following pollarding of large trees., 10th July
item.description:
The pavement is almost entirely blocked by the ground level branches on these trees. It is extremely dangerous as pedestrians cannot pass and are forced to walk in the road. Northfield Road is busy and speeds are often above 30 mph. This needs urgent attention due to risk to life.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northfield Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge needs cutting back, 10th July
item.description:
The hedge has been left to grow out into the pavement and making it difficult for wheelchairs, pushchairs and people with young children to get past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Henslowe Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the grass by the 428 bus stop, 10th July
item.description:
Owners are not picking up after there dogs on the grass area. It's right by a footpath and pavement, also back gate access to over 3 houses. This has been happening for 2 months now and I no longer feel comfortable asking people to pick up after there pets. I asked nicely once and even provided a bag for them and it was not taken well by the lady and I'm hoping signage from the council would be a great benefit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northend Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cedar tree fallout, 10th July
item.description:
See my previous pictures sent in earlier years, well it's much heavier. I've swept the road and the parking bay so that the refuse road sweeper can access the piles. I have a refuse bin and 2 sacks full with needles and cones swept off my grass and property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Consort Drive, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Failed road surface on newly layed surface., 10th July
item.description:
Lane 3 on the newly layed section of carriageway, just after Bornewood gravel pit but before the bridge . Failed road surface . Since the hot weather the road has buckled causing a very large " bump" in lane 3 . Whilst on my motorbike 10/07/25 I hit this at 70mph . It felt like hitting a kerb . This is a fatality waiting to happen , it was by luck I didn't loose control . This is a serious defect which requires immediate attention
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A20, St Mary Cray, Swanley
Report on FixMyStreet
